name: Sheraton Amsterdam Airport Hotel and Conference Center

reviews.text: Howdy,
reviews.title: Not too friendly to the frequent returning platinum guest

reviews.text: I travel to this hotel very often in my travels and have been a platinum with Starwood for many years. This hotel is overall very nice as it has a great location attached to the Amsterdam Airport. The rooms are average to above average.
reviews.title: So Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One problem you will encounter if spoiled with American SPG properties is the Europeon habit of pushing two twin beds together and somehow calling it a queen suite. They don't even put a queen or full size comforter on the bed. It gets made with two separate twin comforters....odd.
reviews.title: Traveler's Haven

reviews.text: My major complaint comes down to the overall attitude towards platinum members at this hotel. I have checked in and been given very poor rooms off the club level and been told it is because I did not pay a lot for the room! Yep, someone got suckered into paying 500 Euros for a standard room so they give them the queen size bed and I get a room with a twin despite being platinum for over a decade. The front desk actually tells me at checkin that I did not pay a lot for the room so that is all they can do. I explain I am platinum and they shrug.
reviews.title: Great location on the Airport, sound proof rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gym at this hotel is small, but very clean and well equipped. They have a nice co-ed steam and dry sauna that is nice except for all the naken men walking around in the co-ed area. The hotel has it clearly posted in pictograph and English form that swimsuits are mandatory. I have seen women half shreek and run back out when they start to come in to the area and see three naken men lying on top of their towels. Mentioned this to the front desk and they shrug and say they will get on top of it. When I have asked the hairy arab men to please put on some clothes, they say it is Europe and they do what they want. You would think they would follow the instruction/rules of the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here one night last week. I pre-booked a King bed Club room, high floor with a view of the airport at a rate of EUR 379 plus tax as this was to be the last night of my birthday holiday and I wanted to end the time off with a stay in a nice hotel.
reviews.title: Great staff but very over priced for what you get....

reviews.text: We arrived from a flight from Montreal. We checked in around 3pm. There were no king rooms ready but given that were really tired we accepted a queen room instead. Overall check in was swift - the girls on reception were lovely and we chatted to them before heading up to our room.
reviews.title: Very convenient, excellent business hotel

reviews.text: The so called "executive" room was fairly large but the view of the airport wasn't what I was expecting - we couldn't see many planes or runways and we just had a view of the main airport area - very disappointing given the description on the hotel website and the fact this is supposed to be an actual paid for benefit (which you choose and costs extra) Also there were stains on the furniture and a couple of small ones on the carpet. There was dust on some of the light fittings which was clearly visible.
reviews.title: Convenient, Comfort & Clean!
Excellent airport hotel. Very expensive
reviews.text: The bathroom was an OK size but it was so disappointing to have an over bath shower instead of a separate shower cubicle and the water pressure and temperature was too variable to be comfortable. I didn't like the shower curtain - it needs to be better quality as does the bed linen which was pretty rough. And the towels were all very small, thin and cheap. Given the prices they charge I would have expected much better.

After a few hours sleep - the one positive is that even during the day the hotel is exceptionally quiet and soundproof - we got showered and went to the Club lounge for a drink. There were a couple of red and white wines on offer together with spirits, beers and soft drinks. The lounge was busy but it still had a nice buzz. Breakfast was also taken in the Club room on the top floor - we got there at 7am when it had opened and there was a good selection both hot and cold food. We didn't stay long as we had a flight to catch but it was a nice start to the day.
reviews.title: Classy Hotel, lovely experience.

reviews.text: I stayed at the Sheraton Amsterdam Airport hotel for two nights while attending a conference. The hotel was very nice, to room was good and the interior pleased the eye. However, there were a few glitches that I was not expecting from a high class hotel like the Sheraton:
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but not excellent
Great business hotel
reviews.text: * There was no information on the reservation or at check-in time if breakfast was included in the room rate. As I was on a business trip, I did not have the chance to check this in advance either. The breakfast at the hotel costs 27€, so I was not very happy with the thought of having to pay that for myself or rush down to the airport for a decently priced breakfast. After checking with the reception, I eventually was informed that the breakfast was included in the room rate.
The breakfast was ok, but the signs indicating the dishes were misplaced.
reviews.title: Convenience has its price

reviews.text: * However, the bigger problem with my stay was with the shower. The shower drain was not working so I had to take a very quick shower before the basin filled. I informed the reception on the problem and they promised to fix it, but the next morning the problem remained.
reviews.title: The best BED!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall my stay was nice, but considering the price and expectation level, I was a bit disappointed.
reviews.title: Convenience, convenience!

likes.disliked: — The price paid compared to what we got (value)

reviews.text: Me, hubby & 3 year old on were here on two occasions, one from 16th - 20th May, 2013, and the 2nd on 24th - 25th May, 2013. We were in Amsterdam for a holiday.
reviews.title: Excellent Staffs, Great Rooms, Nice Coffee :)

reviews.text: The reception was fast, no fuss at all. The room was great! On 1st occasion, we were placed on the 5th floor. The room was neat & spacious enough for the 3 of us. Water pressure was good, nothing to complain. The 2nd time we were placed on the 1st floor, the room was even better with an extra bed for my son. The room was facing the runaway so the view was very nice.. The pillows & the mattress was so comfy, I didn't feel like leaving the room!
reviews.title: Very conveniently located (but pricy) hotel
Business Meeting
reviews.text: We arrived at 6.30am thousands of kilometers away from Amsterdam, although we did not get to check in early, we were free to leave our luggage in the store room without any extra charges. Room was ready when we return for check in at around 2 pm.

You can already see the sign of the hotel from airport, just take the connecting bridge and u'll be there in only a few seconds.. Being so close to the airport, one will think that there will be so much noise from the landing & taking off, but we didn't hear a single sound from the aircraft! The room is nicely soundproofed to give the guest a good sleep & relaxing place. As for the tv, there are a few choices for the programmes which is sufficient for us..
reviews.title: Excellent stay for Amsterdam layover, walk from gate to airport

reviews.text: We had our breakfast with the cabin crew of MAS since hubby works for MAS. The pancakes were so nice & fluffy, i wish I had time to eat it for the last time before we check out on 25th but we were rushing for departure, but hey, there will always be a 2nd time visit :)
reviews.title: Great business location

reviews.text: Indoor easy access walkway to the airport. Large comfortable rooms, very good breakfast buffet,
reviews.title: At the airport..very convenient
Flawless
reviews.text: friendly staff anxious to please. We were part of an excellent buffet prepared on short notice for 130 people.
Being close to the airport we expected a noisy stay but that was not the case. Basically what you expect at a Sheraton location. Recommended.
reviews.title: Internet broken? Tell your guests!

reviews.text: Everything about this hotel is perfection. Location, price and room amenities. I ordered room service from the kids menu and had a satisfying healthy meal. Clean, modern and quiet with friendly staff and speedy reception
reviews.title: Close to Airport

reviews.text: The Sheraton Amsterdam Airport is usually one of my favorite airport hotels. It is conveniently located close to the terminal, it usually has spotless service and relatively comfortable rooms. Not luxurious accommodations but functional. I stay here at least 3-4 times a year, on my way in or out of Amsterdam. My only complaint is typically that the check in and check out waiting time is too long because there are not enough front desk staff or staff are trainees that require a lot of assistance. I usually give it a high rating. This last stay, however, revealed the not so good side of the hotel: the internet service was not working, but the front end staff did not tell at check in. To me and to many business travellers, internet connection is not a luxury but a necessity. Had the hotel staff been more open and forward about the problem I would probably have gone to another hotel. But instead they provided many excuses and apologies, but no solutions. Therefore my rating this time is lower. Sorry Sheraton, you should do better!
reviews.title: Convenient & Attached to the Airport

reviews.text: Stayed one night between a flight from Africa and return leg to US in Oct 07. Have stayed at this hotel several times, primarily between flights. I appreciate the convenience of its location and ease of getting to the terminal for international check-ins. I like not having to wait for a shuttle bus or take a taxi. I usually get a rate of 150Euro which I find fairly cheap for airport hotels in Europe. Rooms are comfortable and I have not had noise problems, although I am always in a room facing the center of the hotel (i.e. not looking at a runway). Food is decent and prices typical of room service.
reviews.title: Favorite hotel at AMS

reviews.text: We were on our way back from our trip to Italy, and were forced to get tickets where we arrived at 10pm in Amsterdam. However, our flight did not leave Schiphol until 10am the next morning. Facing a 12 hour layover at night, we decided to give the Sheraton a try.
reviews.title: Layover Paradise in Amsterdam

reviews.text: We are very glad we did. It is the perfect stay if you are having an extended layover in Amsterdam/Schiphol Airport. The rooms are top notch, with some of the most comfortable beds available at hotel chains, many free amenities, clean and extremely comfortable rooms, and the best is that you do not have to worry about catching a shuttle or getting stuck in traffic trying to get back to the airport! You just roll of of bed, get ready, and walk directly into the airport without having to walk outside at all. Plus, their TV's link directly into the airport news network so you keep updated regarding arrivals and departures.
reviews.title: Quick stay at Sheraton - fine
Great Place to stay, especially if you like the Aeroplanes
reviews.text: Would recommend for anyone facing hours at the airport in Amsterdam! Well worth the money spent! (They even gave us a free upgrade for no charge.)
My flight was delayed 13 hours, so Eva-Air kindly put me up in a club room on the 7th floor, at the Sheraton across from the Airport until the flight departed.
reviews.title: Convenient

reviews.text: With Schiphol a hub for a significant part of my travels, the location of the hotel is just great. The amenities is good. The fitness room is more roomy than most hotel gyms I've experienced and well equipped. The rooms are excellent and beds comfortable. The service is friendly and efficient. Great soundproofing makes sure one is not bothered at all by airport noises. Easy connection to both the airport and the station with trains to all over Netherlands and beyond. Location, location, location indeed.
reviews.title: A very good airpprt hotel

reviews.text: I was on a layover and spent a night at the hotel. It's a 5 minute walk from the train terminal, just take the skyway over the road.
reviews.title: A good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Location/Location/Location (It was great!)
reviews.title: Pretty Good Aiport Hotel

reviews.text: 2. The Gym was good
reviews.title: Ideal business hotel

reviews.text: 3. The room was fantastic.
reviews.title: Never would know it was airport hotel!
Best hotel at AMS
reviews.text: I've stayed at several hotels at Amsterdam airport and this is by far the best. Of course the location is a major plus, but this isn't the only reason to prefer the Sheraton. On my previous trip I stayed at the Hilton which is also well-located within walking distance to the terminal, but the Hilton's rooms were abysmal in comparison.

reviews.title: Loved the Sheraton
reviews.text: My standard room at the Sheraton had a fantastic bathroom with separate tub and walk-in shower. It also had a wonderfully comfortable bed, coffee/tea making facilities, and working temperature controls! Breakfast the next morning was fantastic, located in a stylish upscale dining room with a large hot buffet selection. The Sheraton also has a small fitness centre (although pretty good compared to many hotel gyms) and also a sauna and steam room. On a more recent trip to Amsterdam, during a long layover, I paid about €15 to access the Sheraton gym so I could shower and wake up in the gym.

reviews.title: Average at best.
reviews.text: Stayed here over Easter holidays this year - fab hotel in a fab location.

reviews.title: Absolutely loved it
reviews.text: Good sized clean and comfortable room, clean and fresh bathroom. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful when we checked in and again when we had to use their Business room facility. The Voyager restaurant serves up some fabulous grub - try it once atleast.

reviews.title: Don't understand the bad reviews
reviews.text: I stayed there one week ago and while I found the room average for a Sheraton I was very disappointed by the reception staff who I found surly and unhelpful.

Great hotel to stay in for short visit. Very convenient as train station to Central Amsterdam is at the airport. My children and I managed to do a lot of things in one day, i.e. visit to Anne Frank's museum, stroll at Dam square, view of the canals, etc.
reviews.title: Short Trip to Amsterdam

reviews.text: The hotel is very clean and staff at the reception were very helpful. Will definitely use this hotel again even on longer stay.
reviews.title: Great Airport Location

reviews.text: We had an early morning long haul flight so we stayed one night here. I'm an SPG Platinum member and we were upgraded to a beautiful suite. It was clean and quiet and my son loved watching the planes from our room. The club lounge was adequate with cold beverages and small snacks. My benefits included free wifi that worked very well and breakfast for two in the restaurant. If breakfast hadn't been included it would have been easy to grab something small at the airport as there is a lot of selection and it's a quick walk from the lobby. I would stay here again and recommend it to others who have early morning flights.
reviews.title: Very bad experience

reviews.text: Very poor customer service. Took almost 20 minutes to check in and about the same to check out. My room was very warm even though the air conditioner was on the coldest settings. Also, there was no coffee available in the room. I voiced my concerns to the desk associate but he only said he was sorry.
reviews.title: Close and comfortable but dont take the buffet breakfast

reviews.text: We chose to layover at this hotel as there was 1 day in between our flights. We had a two room family room suite with dining table and sleeper sofa that worked out very well with the kids even though it was quite expensive. The room was quite large and fit all of our needs. It was clean, quite and comfortable not to mention located right in the airport. The staff was helpful and the consierge was helpful with getting a taxi and sight seeing in dowtown. The internet services in the lobby was very useful as well. My only complaint was the price of the buffet breakfast. It cost $29.00 Euros per person and they even wanted to charge for my children ages 7 and 4 so we chose to eat in the airport.
reviews.title: Convenient , but over-priced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed there this summer with my wife on a overnight layover before catching a flight to the United States after 2 weeks in Europe. This is an airport hotel and one expectations should be aligned with that. This is place where people arrive, eat, drink, rest and shower with minimal hassle before heading out on the next leg of their journey.
reviews.title: Hassle free travel

reviews.text: This hotel rates very highly in that category. It is very short walk from the airport and was easy to find. The Hotel is modern and clean. We received prompt and courteous service at check-in. My wife and I had a drink at the bar. The bartender was personable and attentive but not chatty. I consider this a plus at an airport hotel. After traveling for two weeks, I just wanted to enjoy a quiet drink with my wife. The room were spacious and adequately appointed. The beds were very comfortable. Most importantly it was quite. We enjoyed a great night sleep and best of all had a leisurely walk to the back terminal in the morning without the usual concerns around arranging airport transportation. The only downside was that I thought it was pricey at over $300 a night ( although I didn't have to pay for cabs to and from the airport)
reviews.title: Can't beat the location

reviews.text: If you are looking for a destination hotel and to experience Amsterdam, I would recommend staying closer to city center. As an airport hotel it was excellent and we will definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Location for the Airport - could brush up on Customer Service

reviews.text: It's literally a 2 minute walk to the inside of the airport/train station. Many stores are located close by and a starbucks. Hotel was very nice, comfortable rooms with modern contemp design. Ate at the voyager restaurant which had good quality food but over priced, and service was lacking, I saw many customers complain about the service including myself. It is a 50 euro taxi ride to the tourist area (or 15 euro train ticket) so keep that in mind if you are spending any time for sight seeing it would make sense to stay elsewhere. For an overnight stay I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Fantastic airport hotel

reviews.text: I arrived on a flight from Heathrow, there was quite a queue at check in and it took about 15 minutes to get to the reception desk. The manner adopted by the check in staff is very 'indifferent'.
reviews.title: Very convenient and relaxing
Great airport hotel
reviews.text: You cannot get a more convenient place to stay at the AMS Airport than this hotel. Room is very nice; many, many TV channels is all languages from English to Japanish to Arabic. Best of all, it is a 5 minute walk (connected) to the AMS lobby. Cannot beat the location for an early flight. Also, not the least bit noisey. Great hotel.

reviews.title: 5- star location, but otherwise.....
reviews.text: My husband and I overnighted at this hotel en route to Singapore from Glasgow. This was our 2nd time here, strictly on account of its unbeatable location visavis the other airport hotels at Schiphol. We had 5 big bags between us, and we did not fancy loading and unloading our bags onto hotel shuttle buses. We could conveniently trundle our luggage straight to the hotel, saving time and effort, but its proximity to the airport for both checkin/out and the train to the city was the main thing going for it. (If walking access to the hotel is not a requirement, the new-ish nearby Dorint Hotel offers a more pleasant and welcoming experience).

reviews.title: A good location for the traveler by air or train
reviews.text: It's just as well we did not pay top dollar for the deluxe room (160 Euros), because it certainly did not luxuriate that 5- star feeling, from check-in till check-out. The only thing to commend the rather dark room was its bedding. The shower cubicle leaked water onto the outside after a shower and we were told that they did not have kettles for rooms when we asked for one, andcwere directed to the coffee and tea station on a higher floor. I found it surprising that a 5- star hotel did not supply complimentary bottles of mineral water.

reviews.title: Walk to Airport - Good for Early In/Out Flights
reviews.text: The next morning, the staff at the front desk misdirected my husband when he enquired about the breakfast venue, due, I suspect, to trainee staff on duty. The Voyager restaurant, to be fair, had a decent buffet spread for 29 Euros.

reviews.title: Convenient location
reviews.text: If we had more time to spend in Amsterdam, we would give this hotel a miss.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Sheraton for one night before travelling on to our honeymoon in Malaysia. We were upgraded to a club suite by the very kind receptionist, beautiful room with access to the club lounge. You really can't beat the location as a stop-over hotel!
reviews.title: Great airport hotel!

reviews.text: I love being able to get off the plane and walk to my hotel. The convenience of having the train station located within 2 minutes of the hotel adds to the convenience. Location, Location, Location.
reviews.title: Great but expensive

reviews.text: The downside is the price. It is the most expensive hotels I stay in in Europe. Might have reached the tipping point this year with the weak USD and I will have to look else where.
reviews.title: Excellent stop over

reviews.text: The room is very good and the service from the staff is excellent. I enjoy the workout room and the sauna. Food is expensive but the Airport food service is two minutes away and very adequate. Just got better with the addition of a Starbucks.
reviews.title: Great Choice!

reviews.text: RECOMMENDED: Short inside walk from airport. Check-in efficient. Rooms well sized and very quiet. Furnishings in good condition. Bath area well illuminated and nice ammenities. Bedding comfortable. This place is though expensive but you can't beat easy access to airport and train station below.
reviews.title: One of the better airport hotels - but more for business stayovers

description: Highrise Hotel situated at Schiphol Int'l Airport with direct access via enclosed walkway to terminals; 10 km to city center.
